comment._content:
The Star  -  Christchurch    -   January  1919    -    War News:

NARBEY - Major W.F.  of Taranaki. -- awarded Croix de Guerre  ---  aged 30

comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
NEW ZEALAND AND WORLD WAR ONE
AUCKLAND WEEKLY NEWS
PERSONNEL PARAGRAPHS
JANUARY 1919

NARBEY, Major W F, has been awarded the Croix de Guerre for conspicuous gallantry. He was formerly farming at Eltham, Taranaki, and left NZ with the Main Body of the Expeditionary Force as Lieutenant. He served at Gallipoli and later in Messines in 1917 where he was wounded. He was gassed in March 1918 and wounded again in August 1918. He was promoted to Captain after the first Somme battle in 1916 and to Major after the battle at Messines. For some time he has been acting as Colonel of his Regiment. His wife resides in Great North Road, Grey Lynn.

comment.author: 10758109@N04
comment._content: He was born 13 Apr 1888 in Long Bay, Banks Peninsula, Canterbury, New Zealand. He died on 17 Jul 1953 in Harrow, London, England.[1] W F NARBEY's Cenotaph database record: muse.aucklandmuseum.com/databases/Cenotaph/51625.detail?O... Cenotaph is overseen by the Auckland War Memorial Museum and is another fabulous link to check for any information on New Zealand enlisted personnel Another fantastic resource I use for research is the Paperspast website. paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast And then if we are even luckier, a copy of the persons military file might be online via Archways [Archives NZ]. By entering the persons name in 'simple search' box you never know what might come up! Ta Da! William Francois NARBY's military records are there! archway.archives.govt.nz/ViewFullItem.do?code=21379377&am... These show he was awarded the Croix de Guerre in 1918. As a sideline, the NARBY's were a very well known family and settlers in Akaroa, on Banks Peninsula, Canterbury, New Zealand. I would say this fellow is an offshoot of them. Also a great site for historic births, deaths and marriages is: www.bdmhistoricalrecords.dia.govt.nz/Home/ From here you can work out spouses, parents and siblings if not sure of relationships in military information and then order certificates. For example if you go to marriage search and type in William NARBEY it shows his wife as Eva Mildred WEBBY and their registration number as 1913/8625. You can then trace their children if any. Another search in Archways shows that William and Eva's divorce was filed c1919: archway.archives.govt.nz/ViewFullItem.do?code=16698000 He married secondly on 27 Mar 1920 in Chapel Royal, Savoy, London, England to Florence GOODMAN, she was born in 1880. She died 3 in Dec 1951 in Harrow, London, England. [1] References: [1] [Information not verified by myself] freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~gtbannan/pafg6... Cheers Sarndra

In some records he is recorded as William Francois Narbey

Possibly the son of Thomas Walter Narbey

comment._content: Web site of New Zealand Electronic Text Centre Part of: New Zealand in the First World War 1914–1918 www.nzetc.org/tm/scholarly/facets/search?document=WH1_Wel... Title: The Wellington Regiment (NZEF) 1914 - 1919 Authors: W. H. Cunningham C. A. L. Treadwell J. S. Hanna Publication details: Ferguson & Osborn, Limited, 1928, Wellington Also: The New Zealand Division 1916 - 1919: A Popular History Based on Official Records Author: Col. H.
